page.title: 15Local History-Sprowston
page.content: It is believed that the village of Sprowston was founded during the 9th century Danish invasion because the name Sprow is a Scandinavian personal name.Ton, of course ,means town or village. When Sprowston was mentioned in the Domesday Book it was a small and rather run down village with two "holdings". These limited and domniated life until late in the 19th century. In the 1930's the fields and lanes began to disappear. Since the last war there has been continued development and the village ,which was once small, has been turned into a large urban community. Recently bulit industrial estates now provide employment for the increased population of 14,309.It is estimated that over 400 new houses will be built in the near future.
